data.name: lblUseCategoriesList.Help
data.value: Controls whether to allow free-text entry of the document category, or to use the 'Document Categories' list defined in the host lists page.

data.name: lblShowTitleAsLink.Help
data.value: Controls whether to display the title as a download link, or as plain text.

data.name: lblDisplayColumns.Help
data.value: Use the visible checkboxes to switch display of columns on and off. You can set the display order of columns using the up and down arrows.

data.name: lblAllowUserSort.Help
data.value: Controls whether to allow users to sort by clicking column headers.

data.name: lblSorting.Help
data.value: Add/remove sort columns to the list to sort the documents module by the selected columns.

data.name: lblDefaultFolder.Help
data.value: Select a folder to serve as the default location for new documents and also to display files from it (then file filter is specified).

data.name: lblFileFilter.Help
data.value: Enter file filter regex, e.g. "\.pdf$". The module will display files from the default folder that names will match provided regex.

data.name: FileFilter.Invalid
data.value: File filter must be valid .NET regex.

data.name: lblFilenameToTitleRules.Help
data.value: With this setting you can control generation of the titles of documents from the names of corresponding files. Each line represents single rule which consists of two parts: a valid .NET regex and a replacement string separated by mandatory "/" sign. By example, the "(?i)\.pdf$/" rule will remove PDF extension (replacement string is empty).

data.name: FilenameToTitleRules.Invalid
data.value: Each rule must consists of two parts: a valid .NET regex and a replacement string separated by mandatory "/" sign.

data.name: lblCategoriesListName.Help
data.value: Select the name of the list you want to use for document categories

data.name: msgNoListsAvailable.Text
data.value: There are no lists available for use. Use the List Editor to manage lists.

data.name: NoListAccess.Text
data.value: In order to create/edit a list you must contact your host admininstator.

data.name: lblDateTimeFormat.Help
data.value: Enter .NET format string for date and time values (e.g. "ddd, dd MMM yyyy") or leave empty to use default format. More info here: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/8kb3ddd4.aspx

data.name: lblGridStyle.Help
data.value: Select one of the available styles for the documents grid.

data.name: lblAutoHide.Help
data.value: Check to autohide module without visible content.
